data.name: Dependency check
data.description:
Implement a method that checks if a dependency tree for compiling libraries can be fulfilled without ending in an endless cycle.

Example: if library `a` depends on library `b` for compiling and library `b` depends on library `a`, none of them can be compiled because we are in an endless cycle `a > b > a > b > a ...`

We can model dependency trees with a hash like:
```ruby
{
  a: :b,
  b: [:c, :d]
  c: :d
}
```

Each entry represents a library (the key) and one or more libraries it depends on (the value). If a library is not mentioned in the hash, it does not have any dependencies. A library may depend on itself.
